snippet: City officials have never explained why Officer Adrian Schoolcraft was forcibly hospitalized by his bosses.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column marvels at how long it took for the story of New York City Police Officer Adrian Schoolcraft to unfold, and scores Mayor Michael R Bloomberg for his continued nonchalance about a case that amounts to grotesque abuse; Schoolcraft is suing the city after he was involuntarily held in a psychiatric hospital in what he says was retribution for whistle-blowing reports against the police department's manipulation of crime statistics.
lead_paragraph: City officials have never explained why Officer Adrian Schoolcraft was forcibly hospitalized by his bosses.

headline.seo: Officer Adrian Schoolcraft, Forcibly Hospitalized, Got No Apology, Just a Bill
headline.main: For Detained Whistle-Blower, a Hospital Bill, Not an Apology
headline.print_headline: For Detained Whistle-Blower, a Hospital Bill, Not an Apology
